headline: Oreo Cheesecake
description: This Oreo cheesecake combines chocolate sandwich cookies and cream cheese with a chocolate cookie crust for a rich, decadent, easy-to-prepare dessert.
name: Oreo Cheesecake
recipeIngredient: 3 (250 g) packages PHILADELPHIA Brick Cream Cheese, softened

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Place 16 cookies in a resealable plastic bag. Flatten bag to remove excess air, then seal bag. Finely crush cookies by rolling a rolling pin across the bag. Place crushed cookies in a bowl. Add melted butter; mix well. Press mixture firmly onto bottom of a 9-inch springform pan.

Beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed until well-blended. Beat in eggs, 1 at a time, until just blended. Chop remaining 8 cookies; gently stir 1/2 of the chopped cookies into cream cheese batter. Pour over prepared crust; sprinkle remaining chopped cookies on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until center is just set, about 45 minutes.
Refrigerate for 3 hours to overnight. Cut cheesecake into 12 equal pieces; store leftovers in the refrigerator.

review.reviewBody: We all loved it! Made it for my momâ€™s 88th on St. Patrickâ€™s Day so we topped it with green cream OreosðŸ’šand choco ganacheâ€¦.the best!
Its good but it need som more oreos
Could you add some of the Oreo cream into the cream cheese mixture ?
Very good Oreo cheesecake recipe, everyone loved it!!
Awesome recipe can't wait to surprise the family with this yumminess of desert for Thanksgiving. Will be adding a melted chocolate topping. ðŸ¥°ðŸ¤¤
Easy and delicious!
I loved this recipe, so simple and delicious
Loved it
Turned out amazing. everyone loved it.
Followed it exactly, came out bussin

I'm gonna give this a 4 star rating because it didn't say whether to use the creme for the crust or not. Took it upon myself to not and I put the creme in the cheesecake filling, also added caramel sauce and extra vanilla and it came out wonderful

I, too, made adaptions as recommended by another reviewer. (I def agree with doubling the Oreos, especially for the crust!)! I wanted a "clean" top to decorate for a 50th birthday so, instead of folding cookies into the cream cheese, I spread half the cream mixture on the crust, added a layer of cookie chunks, then poured the remaining cream cheese mixture on top. I reserved a handful of cookies for the final topping. I finely chopped them to dust the top of the cake. This not only concealed the cracks but provided a great backdrop for the other birthday flair I added. Overall, the cake turned out just as beautiful as it tasted!
The bomb

Recipe was too small for my pan, so increased it. Kids loved decorating the cake.

Hope it tastes good.

Itâ€™s good but it was missing a little something. It wasnâ€™t quite there yet. I added a ganache on the top of it and itâ€™s perfect! (Melt cream and chocolate chips in a saucepan and cover the cheesecake with it)
The only changes I made to this recipe was to add a bit of sour cream and more broken cookie pieces to the batter. My son requests this cheesecake every year for his bday

I made it yesterday, but I made a lighter version of that and when I taste it, it is really light and sweet and even healthier, lighter, and smoother than regular cheesecake and it was because for the crust, I use almond milk instead of butter and for the batter, I use honey instead of sugar and maple syrup for vanilla extract substitution, even though I ran out of vanilla extract, so that what I made a lighter cheesecake.
Delicious
Added a chocolate drizzle
I would absolutely make it again, the only change that I made was putting 1 teaspoon of lime in it, my aunt said it would enhance the flavor.
We did not care for this
was a lot more batter than one cake, so i had to divide it into 2. but other than, delish. thank you!
Great recipe
I will definitely make it again. It is so easy, but tastes so good
Came out amazing!

So yummy! Followed the recipe exactly but added a few more Oreos to the batter and top as another person recommend. Everyone loved it! I didn't have the right cake pan so I just lined a regular pan with parchment and lifted it out after cooling it. Not picture perfect but good enough!

Four stars for some consistently mentioned things in other reviews. There was a tanginess missing in the recipe. Add the sour cream or yogurt. Although making the cheesecake without it cracking seems to randomly happen when I do it. I also â€œuppenedâ€ the recipe for a 9â€ spring pan...4 packages of cream cheese, 3 eggs and a yolk, 1 cup of sugar. Just for kicks, I made a mascarpone ganache to cover up my cracks...my family loved it and the neighbors offered to buy one...

gotta say I'm impressed! tried a few different recipes and this one was the easiest and better tasting. one thing people are saying is that it's missing a few ingredients but take into account that it says EASY right in the title if you want a more complex flavor profile then go nuts that's why it's so good because you can add whatever other items you want but it's a great starting point and a great recipe by itself so don't let other people's tastes and reviews stop you from atleast trying it! :)
I only did 2 packages of cream cheese and divided the rest of the recipe down to do it smaller because I only had two cream cheeses but it still worked out great

This was a very easy and simple to follow recipe. I ended up doing this as a birthday cake for one of my friends. I knew they were going to be a lot of people so I doubled the recipe, which ended up making 2-9â€ pie pans and a dozen cupcakes. Going by the normal recipe, it calls for 3/4 cup sugar, doubling that is 1-1/2 cups of sugar, so I omitted half a cup of sugar and use the Oreo filling instead which balanced out the flavor of the cheesecake. It was the perfect sweetness for the cupcakes, I used the rest of the crushed Oreo I had for the crust and placed it at the bottom of the cups. This filled half the pan, for the other 6 I used while Oreos as the crust and placed the rest of the cheesecake filling on top of them. For the filling of the cheesecake and the Oreos on top, are used peppermint Oreos which added a nice flavor to it. Upon my little cupcake experiment, both were very good but I opted to go with the crushed crust. I hope you find this helpful!

I have made this several times, I put the oreo cream in with the batter and may consider adding sour cream and heavy cream at some point. for now it's a great savory and not too sweet cheesecake recipe that I can enjoy
Very indulgent. You can easily divide the recipe into a third to make variations of smaller flavours. Crush the Oreos very finely to cover the cake on top and it looks very nice.
It was delicious! I did not change anything. Everyone loved it! Thank you!
it was to die for and off-the-HOOOOOOOOK!!

I left the cream in the oreos when I made the crust (not sure if that was right). Based on previous reviews, I added a 1/2 cup of heavy cream and a few tablespoons of sour cream to the batter. I also doubled the vanilla and used 12 oreos in the batter instead of 8 and covered it with chocolate ganache. I made all these changes and it was still bland. Not a recipe I'd try again.
I love this recipe it was amazing
I just added a little for oreo crumbs! but that was just for me!
I made this cake for my birthday and it was yummy. I was really happy that this recipie didn't have sour cream in it.
Awesome recipe! Super delicious and easy to make! A sure treat for the kids, family and friends. The toughest part is waiting to eat! Enjoy!
Great and easy
Excellent
Easy to make and tastes great both warm and chilled!
My husband LOVES it!
I made this for my mother's birthday and she loved it. The only thing that I would change is the number of Oreo cookies because the amount listed didn't work for me.
it is the best
I love this recipe! I did tweek somethings but not too much. Overall it was awesomely GREAT! Will make again!
This was my first homemade cheesecake and Iâ€™m impressed how well it turned out!

Lots of reviewers said you would need to add sour cream or cream, but I didn't and I have to say I really loved it the way it is! I guess maybe I'm just into a thicker cheesecake. I thought it was the perfect sweetness and texture! I used lactose free cream cheese and ALL the oreos. More than the recipe calls for, I like it with lots of oreo flavor and I was not disappointed! Just a note: watch this one in the oven. As other reviewers have said it overcooks easily!

This cheesecake was a big hit with my staff, but not at my family reunion. A few people raved about it and others just liked it. I thought it was pretty good, but not "knock your socks off" awesome. 
I would make this again.
I made this with coconut sugar, goat cream cheese and gluten free cookies. OMG it's amazing. The coconut sugar gives it a really nice flavor. It's a keeper for sure.
This wasn't as great as I thought it would be. The crust got soggy. It should have been pre-baked before the batter is poured in. The flavor of the cake was unremarkable. I won't make this one again.
The batter tasted better than the actual cake. You might want to cook it a little long, the center was still a little soft.

Easy and delicious. I used the food processor to get a fine cookie crust and set a little to the side to use in the cream cheese filling. It turned out great and my family loved it. I will use this recipe from now on.
Yes will make it again, really quick to put together. Just added Cool Whip to serve.

I made this cheesecake as a surprise for my sisters birthday. She absolutely loved it! I ended up making two and it was great. However I did add about a tablespoon of heavy cream, and be careful not to over mix as well. The cream I found made it more dense and moist. Great and easy to make!!
I loved this cheesecake I made it for my family and they loved it! But adding a little something extra wild be good. I added a few mini chocolate chips and it was really good

I liked this cheesecake after it cooled overnight in fridge vs 3 hours after cooling cheesecake to room temperature. I used Raskas Cream cheese and I think this cream cheese is phenomenal compared to Philadelphia brand for making cheese cake. my husband never cared for Oreo cheesecake, but he enjoyed this recipe. His favorite cheesecake is Chantal's New York Cheesecake which you can find in All Recipes.

Made it according to instructions. Simple and easy to make. Didn't have a springform pan though so it wasn't the best looking cake but the taste was definitely yummy according to everyone who tasted it!
I used Oliviani Olive Oil butter for the base.

Used red velvet Oreos instead. Also, I didn't put my remaining Oreos into the cream cheese/vanilla/sugar/eggs mix...I took the cream out of those cookies, crushed them, and sprinkled them on my baked cheesecake. Also put a thin layer of whipped cream on top ??

My sister and i made this cheesecake, and it was the first cheesecake we've ever made, because of previous reviews, we added sour cream to it, and we used red velvet Oreos instead of regular, and while it did end up cracking in the middle, it was delightful, and loved by the whole family,
I used mint Oreos.

I was successful in making it, so there's a plus on it's side.
However, no matter what I did I could not get the crust up off the pan, I'm not looking forward to washing it. The resulting cheesecake was tasty and dense, the way I like it. I will be making it again, but tweaking the amount of butter in the crust.
I followed the recipe exactly, and the result was delicious! Perfect for a cheesecake lover.
turned out great, my girls couldn't get enough
Really easy and delicious cake!!! I just added a chocolate glaze on the top

This recipe is very similar to the basic cheesecake I use as a base to play with. Used only the chocolate cookie part of the Oreos in the crust with the butter; and added the cream filling into the cream cheese batter.

I give this a 4 because it tasted great but the consistency was not your typical cheesecake. I took some other advice from 2 other reviews and added a little bit of lemon juice and I used the whole package of cookies (cream and all). It reminded me of a cheesecake brownie because the texture was a bit thick. Next time I will try making it with sour cream and see if the consistency is better. Thanks!

it turned out so good, it was my second time making it and i added more oreos for my taste, but my family n cousins loved it, they asked me too make more for all of them, so I'm making a lot of batches today. overall everyone loved the cheesecake, it was so good n rich. Most my cheese cakes turn out spongy but this one was P.E.R.F.E.C.T. I'll make it again on special days. the cheesecae had my friends dying for more!

Easier to serve if you make this into cupcakes, I put a whole Oreo in the bottom of each cupcake paper and pour the batter over top, I also mix 1/2 cup chocolate chips into the batter and then bake same temp but for 25 minutes or until set. Spray whipped cream on top of each cupcake when serving, it's a huge hit!!!

:( I love cheesecake and enjoy making them but hadnt made kne in a while. Decided to try this one out and it was a major flop. the crust turned out really hard, and the filling was a very odd and kind of spounge like texture.
I've made this about 5 times. It's easy and our whole family loves it. I top with whipping cream and a Hershey chocolate sauce drizzle.
Just made it for Thanksgiving desert. DELICIOUS!!!!!!
I love the taste. So good.
Was over all good but was not a big fan of the crust. My try a pre-made OREO pie crust next time!
I used I tablespoon sugar in the crumbs. Not a whole lot you can add to this recipe huge hit even with "I don't like cream cheese cake" guest.

My teenage son and friends wanted to make a cheesecake one Saturady night and we chose this easy recipe. Mixed ingredients and made exactly per recipe. It went into the oven (lowered temp to 320 degrees because of dark pan) and I let the kids takeover from there. Told them to make sure it wasn't jiggling in the middle before they took it out.
This morning I found it in the fridge only a few slices remaining so treated myself to some for breakfast. OMG, this cheesecake is delicious! I really don't care for "Oreo" anything, but I have to say, especially considering how easy it was to make, this is one of the best cheesecakes I've ever tasted. Totally rivals any Cheesecake Factory cheesecake for sure...
When I tried this recipe i did 2 eggs and half a cup of sourcream. It was amazing. i will use this recipe again
OMG. East to make and to die for!!!

I was very disappointed in this recipe. I thought it would be an easy recipe to teach my son how to make cheesecake. It turned out very dry. It needs sour cream or milk..... anything to give it that "melt in your mouth" softness. This did not have that. I will never make this again.

Super easy recipe. The only things I did differently are...I used more Oreos for the pie crust (24) and baked it for 8-9 minutes. I also used more cookies to mix with the cream cheese mixture and to sprinkle on top of the cheesecake. Once the cheesecake cools I will drizzle caramel sauce on top.
Have been meaning to try this one for a long time and I'm so glad I finally did. I followed the recipe exactly and it turned out wonderful. It was a hit with everyone!

I haven't tried the finish result, but from tasting the filling before baking- I know that it will be delicious. The MAIN problem I have with this recipe is the clarity. For someone who has never made, much less never had, Oreo Cheesecake... the recipe does not specify enough on what to do. Obviously for the crust you have to take the cream out of the cookies, but it does not say that. "24 Oreo Cookies, divided". Divided what? In half? Into 3rds? One pile of 8, One pile of 16? Divided how??? That may need to be revised and reworded to prevent confusion for other first-time bakers out there!

I was so feared up with taking on my first cheesecake, but I was seriously more than pleased with this. I changed things up a little to my own liking, but I feel like it'd be good regardless. I only used two eggs, added some heavy cream, and doubled the vanilla. I also used an obscene amount of Oreos. It was perfect. I'll make this recipe again in different cookie forms. Do it!
This was easy and very yummy! I made if for my hubby for Father's Day, and froze the rest. A month later, I swear it's even better frozen!!

This was AMAZING!! So I am writing this review to be of help to future people who stumble on this like I did while on I was on Pintrest. After 30 minutes of arguing with my boyfriend over whether or not the white filling of the oreo should be crush up for the crust or not, I finally made the decision and did it anyway. It is not clear whether you should or shouldn't keep the cream with the crushed cookies, and in the picture it looks completely black. Well let me tell you, the crust was black and it was amazing WITH THE FILLING IN IT!! lol I love when I can prove men wrong. tehehehe (I think he secretly liked it too). P.S. I added about 2 TBL of Sour cream to my recipe after reading Ashley's review.

I give the recipe 5 stars because it is a great starter, but the recipe is unfinished. First of all, you should never have only cream cheese in the batter. I added a 14 oz can of sweetened condensed milk and a cup of vanilla yogurt. When you add the eggs, separate them first and stir the yolk and whites separately. This is a technique used for making cakes but for cheesecake will make the end result a light and fluffy cheesecake. I prefer it this way because you can really only take a couple bites of a heavy cheesecake. Then I used double oreos for everything. Double the oreo batter for the crust and double how many crushed oreos you put in the batter. Then I broke off chunks of oreos to add to the batter as well. While baking, I took the advice of another review on here and started the temp at 350 then lowered it by 25 degrees every 20 minutes while baking (bake for a total of an hour) then turn the heat off and leave the cake in the oven with the door closed for an additional hour. I didn't use a waterbath but using this method, the cheesecake came out perfectly smooth and crack-free!! It was incredible and we didn't even wait for it to cool completely before eating it because it looked so good!! Will definitely be making this again. One last note, make sure ALL your ingredients are at room temperature. Hope this helps and enjoy your cheesecake!!! :)

I must give this recipe a 5. It was very simple to make and i got so many compliments from it. The funnest thing after making it is plating it. I made it into single serve dishes and they turned out great.
All i can say is YUM!
It definitely needed some condensed milk, sour cream, and a tiny bit of flour. Otherwise, good recipe.
Kinda tasteless...
To me it was just OK. The guests gobbled it up. Thought it could have been higher. Probably won't make it again :(
This was awesome, and super easy! Great for someone who hasn't made cheesecake before (me).
My Hubby LOVES this. My daughter made this for him. Simple and so good !!!

Ive tried this recipe two different times. The very first time i bought the oreo pie crust. And I took some users advice and added a spoonful of sourcream, I also added some lemon extract just a teaspoon possible (I dont measure). The cheese cake turned out really good. Im sure I added more sugar it was rather sweet and very rich. I also used only one package of creamcheese. Now I made this yesterday from scratch and the pie crust wasnt so good. I may have added more butter than I was suppose to and cookies because it wasnt dried out.But the cream cheese was awesome. Il have to make this maybe two more times to perfect this.
Delicious! I made it for my birthday and everyone loved it!!! Simple delicious!

Over here from this side of the world Philly Cheese is super expensive i choose tatura cheese from AU.
Not sure why my cake always crack although is taste really good
Very easy to make! Great flavor, not too overly sweet. My husband likes it served with a drizzle of chocolate syrup.

this is a very simple affective cheesecake, but i agree with the last review it needed something extra, so i advise you to add some 3 tbls of marshmallow fluff. it adds a different texture. you can purchase fluff from asda, Morrisons next to the peanut butter, give it a shot :)
I added sourcream to better the texture of the cheesecake and to better balance the flavours. Worked out great! I cooked it for a household of men and they LOVED it!
